intro: Leucophysalis yunnanense, commonly known as the Yunnan leucophysalis, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features include a hairy stem, aromatic foliage, and a short flowering period in the spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
